intro: Sericocoma somalensis, commonly known as the Somali sericocoma, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Somalia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to withstand high temperatures and low rainfall. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, helping to reduce water loss, while its flowers are small and clustered, often displaying a yellow or white color. Sericocoma somalensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
